name: TEXO Ventures
overview:
The team behind TEXO Ventures has a long, solid history of investing in, building and caring about healthcare companies that make a difference.

TEXO Ventures takes its name from the Latin “texo”, meaning to build with great care. TEXO does exactly that, making early-stage investments in healthcare companies and then working in collaboration with founding entrepreneurs to build value. TEXO believes that the first stages of commercialization are critical to a company’s long-term success and its team understands the importance of making and supporting smart decisions from the beginning.

TEXO is committed to early-stage investments in compelling healthcare companies. TEXO looks to partner with passionate entrepreneurs dedicated to advancing the art, science, and business of healthcare. Ideal ventures have leadership teams with a strong history of innovation, research, and business success. The team and the “idea” must be committed to improving the way healthcare is delivered.

TEXO looks to invest across the following sectors:

• Health IT • Technology-enabled Services • Home Healthcare • Managed Care • Chronic Disease Management • Medical Devices • Functional Diagnostics and Imaging • Personalized Medicine

TEXO has a particular interest in the convergence of healthcare services and health IT.

The looming U.S. healthcare reform will create a myriad of opportunities for entrepreneurs that deliver products and services that improve the way doctors (and the healthcare system) help patients. TEXO Ventures is excited about the unprecedented prospects for the next 10-15 years to invest in meaningful companies that are changing the face of healthcare.

milestones.description: TEXO Ventures invests $900,000 in Wenzel Spine, an Austin-based medical device company developing innovative stand-alone solutions to stabilizing the spine.
milestones.source_description: TEXO Ventures Half Angel Funding, Half VC

milestones.description: TEXO Ventures leads a $750,000 investment in Waldo Health, an Austin-based telehealth company commercializing an innovative platform for remote patient monitoring.
milestones.source_description: TEXO Ventures Leads Investment in Waldo Health

milestones.description: TEXO Ventures leads $2M investment in Ortho Kinematics, an Austin-based medical diagnostics company that has developed an automated functional diagnostic test for the spine that uses fluoroscopy to capture the spine in motion, producing patient-specific g
milestones.source_description: TEXO Ventures Leads Investment in Ortho Kinematics

milestones.description: TEXO Ventures, which launches and funds health-care start-ups using a pledge-fund model, recently helped two companies get off the ground: Alafair Biosciences, Inc. and Employer Direct Healthcare, Inc.
milestones.source_description: TEXO Ventures Helps Employer Direct, Alafair Get Off The Ground

milestones.description: Ortho Kinematics' a private company focused on revolutionizing spine motion analysis, announced receiving 510(k) clearance from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for the KineGraph VMA(TM) (Vertebral Motion Analyzer) system. The KineGraph VMA system is
milestones.source_description: Ortho Kinematics Receives FDA 510(k) Clearance for KineGraph VMA System

milestones.description: TEXO has evolved from its previous pledge-fund model by raising a traditional venture fund to take advantage of opportunities to invest in early-stage healthcare companies.
milestones.source_description: TEXO Ventures I, LP has its First Close
